ch.phonon

Class StarPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.phonon.PointInPictureBase
      • ch.phonon.StarPoint

  • public class StarPoint
extends PointInPictureBase
    A StarPoint represents the global location of an object in reference to the global coordinate system in the pictureSystem base . Drawable objects have an internal LocalOrientation relative to the StarPoint.
    Author:
    phonon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StarPoint()
      The standard constructor is identified with the global coordinate (0,0) of the PictureBase.
      StarPoint(double x, double y)
      This constructor allows to set directly the components of the star point in the PictureBase.
      StarPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double point)
      This constructor creates a StarPoint based on a Point2D.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object clone() 
      static StarPoint createRotatedStarPoint(StarPoint a, double angle)
      Rotates the components of a StarPoint about an angle and gives back a new StarPoint object with the resulting rotated StarPoint.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      StarPoint equality means bit level equality of the double precission coordinate components.

      Calculates the (smaller and always positive angle) of two StarPoints using the cosine equation.

      Calculates the ciunter clockwise oriented angle, that is positive from StarPoint a to b ; 0 <= angle(b,a) < 360.0

      • getAngleOrientation

        public static double getAngleOrientation(StarPoint a,
                         StarPoint b)
        Calculates the angle orientation of b above a. It is negative, when the oriented angle(a,b) > 180 degree.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        angle orientation

      • getOrientedAngle

        public static double getOrientedAngle(StarPoint a,
                      StarPoint b)
        Calculates the oriented angle of two StarPoints The angle is oriented from a to b. Angle of b above a is counted negative, when it exceeds 180 degree.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        perproduct

      • getAngle

        public static double getAngle(StarPoint a,
              StarPoint b)
        Calculates the (smaller and always positive angle) of two StarPoints using the cosine equation. The angle is not oriented: angle(a,b) = angle(b,a) with 0 < angle < 180
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        smaller unoriented angle
        See Also:
        oriented angle

      • getCounterClockWiseAngle

        public static double getCounterClockWiseAngle(StarPoint a,

        Parameters:

        b -

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        StarPoint equality means bit level equality of the double precission coordinate components. The slightest difference would lead already to false.

        equals in class java.lang.Object
